intro: Spergularia bracteata, commonly known as the sand spurry, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Spergularia bracteata is often found in dunes and along shorelines, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
